tooltip:
HB2002

Expands laws regarding preservation of
participating properties that are publicly
supported housing.

HB2005

Provides definitions relating to comparable work
for purposes of pay equity provisions.

HB2008

Updates amount landlord must pay tenant of
manufactured dwelling park upon closure of park to
convert to other use.

HB2012

Defines "Eastern Oregon Border Economic
Development Region." Establishes Eastern
Oregon Border Economic Development Board, in
collaboration with Oregon Business Development
Department, to formulate and implement strategies
and practices for strategic investment in
workforce development and economic development in
Eastern Oregon Border Economic Development Region
and to make grants or loans to eligible applicants
to encourage workforce development and economic
development in region.

HB2013

Modifies requirements for preschool program
administered by Early Learning Division.

HB2015

Directs Oregon Health Authority, in coordination
with Traditional Health Workers Commission, to
biennially review, and revise if necessary, any
reimbursement rates for doulas.

HB2017

Modifies and adds laws related to transportation.

HB2022

Excludes volumetric mixers from definition
of "fixed load vehicle." Makes additional
nonsubstantive housekeeping changes to definition.

HB2030

Removes certain restriction on number of
nonresident annual black bear tags that may be
issued by State Fish and Wildlife Commission for
general hunting season.

HB2031

Permits owner of Metolius resort site to apply
to county for approval of small-scale recreation
community within three years if owner meets
certain requirements.

HB2038

Modifies purposes for which school districts may
receive grants to pay for costs incurred by school
districts to purchase food produced or processed
in state.

HB2066

Extends sunset for tax credits for reservation
enterprise zones, affordable housing lenders,
rural medical providers and fish screening
devices.

HB2088

Authorizes city within county with population
greater than 700,000 to define "area" as city in
which property is located, for purposes of certain
ad valorem property taxation statutes.

HB2089

Allows liquor stores and distillery retail outlet
agents to sell vermouth.

HB2090

Provides that person engages in unlawful trade
practice if person publishes on website related
to person's business, or in consumer agreement
related to consumer transaction, statement or
representation of fact in which person asserts
that person, in particular manner or for
particular purposes, will use, disclose, collect,
maintain, delete or dispose of information
that person requests, requires or receives from
consumer and person uses, discloses, collects,
maintains, deletes or disposes of in

HB2091

Authorizes Public Utility Commission to use
universal service fund moneys to encourage
broadband service availability and to provide
support to telecommunications carriers that
provide both basic telephone service and broadband
service.

HB2095

Allows metropolitan service district to revise
demonstration of sufficient buildable lands on
single occasion under certain circumstances and
to expand urban growth boundary if metropolitan
service district concludes expansion is warranted.

HB2099

Changes water management and conservation plan
approval condition for extension of time to
construct works or perfect right for municipal use
of water.

HB2100

Provides that portion of U.S. Highway 20 shall be
known as Oregon Medal of Honor Highway.

HB2101

Directs Legislative Counsel to prepare open
government impact statement for measures that
affect disclosure, or exemption from disclosure,
of public records.

HB2103

Permits licensed nurse practitioners to perform
vasectomies.

HB2111

Prohibits inclusion of provisions prohibiting
installation and use of solar panels for obtaining
solar access in declaration or bylaws of planned
community.

HB2113

Adds secular organizations to list of persons and
entities authorized to solemnize marriages.

HB2114

Directs Oregon Medical Board, Oregon State Board
of Nursing, Oregon Board of Naturopathic Medicine
and Oregon Board of Dentistry to provide licensees
of boards with opioid and opiate prescribing
guidelines and recommendations established by
association of licensee practitioners.

HB2123

Limits number of voting members of Oregon
State Hospital Advisory Board serving on ad hoc
committees established by board to less than
quorum.

HB2132

Expands purposes for which improvements may be
made under local government financing program to
include energy storage, smart electric vehicle
charging stations and water efficiency.

HB2134

Changes process by which Public Utility Commission
collects moneys from electric companies for
purposes related to low-income electric bill
payment assistance.

HB2140

Requires seller of real property to disclose
seismic risk in seller's property disclosure
statement.

HB2143

Designates first Saturday in June of each year as
Oregon Outdoor Recreation Day.

HB2147

Requires each post-secondary institution of
education to provide Higher Education Coordinating
Commission with number of Oregon high school
graduates from each school district enrolled at
institution and graduation rate at institution
for Oregon high school graduates from each school
district.

HB2149

Provides for one-time, decreased vehicle
registration fee for former prisoners of war.

HB2150

Directs Oregon Liquor Control Commission to
allow manufacturers or importing distributors of
wine, cider or malt beverages to file required
statements and pay privilege taxes by electronic
means.

HB2152

Permits small business development centers to use
grant funds for outreach and marketing.

HB2156

Requires Department of Revenue to establish
program by means of which representatives of C
corporations and S corporations may resolve issues
and ask questions concerning Oregon corporate
income and excise tax laws or application of
Oregon corporation income and excise tax laws.

HB2157

Requires Department of Revenue to establish
program by means of which department may give
priority to certified public accountants and other
tax practitioners who have questions about or wish
to resolve issues concerning Oregon tax laws or
application of Oregon tax laws to personal income
tax accounts.

HB2159

Changes definition of "cider" for purposes of
alcohol control laws and alcohol taxation laws.

HB2160

Increases number of nonmanufacturing locations at
which brewery-public house licensee may conduct
authorized sales activities.

HB2161

Provides that amendments to bylaws of credit union
are automatically effective unless disapproved by
Director of Department of Consumer and Business
Services.

HB2162

Requires state contracting agency that awards
public improvement contract with contract price
of more than $5 million to require contractor
to employ apprentices to perform 10 percent of
work hours on public improvement that workers in
apprenticeable occupations perform.

HB2175

Removes limitation on number of sobering
facilities that may be registered with Oregon
Health Authority.

HB2176

Authorizes moneys in Mental Health Alcoholism and
Drug Services Account to be used by counties to
provide funding to sobering facilities.

HB2179

Permits onsite treatment of septage prior to
application of biosolids on exclusive farm use
land using treatment facilities that are portable,
temporary and transportable by truck trailer
during authorized period of time.

HB2186

Provides that Director of Department of Consumer
and Business Services may certify self-insurance
program created by intergovernmental agreement
as self-insured employer for purposes of workers'
compensation insurance.

HB2189

Establishes statute of repose for actions arising
out of real estate appraisal activity.

HB2191

Authorizes Secretary of State to investigate
alleged or potential violations of business
entity statutes and to require business entity
to provide list of shareholders and respond to
interrogatories.

HB2192

Increases term of Workers' Compensation
Management-Labor Advisory Committee members from
two years to three years.

HB2197

Allows Department of Revenue to enter into
agreement with qualified governing body of
federally recognized Indian tribe for purpose
of making rebate payments for estimate of tax on
marijuana items.

HB2198

Establishes Oregon Cannabis Commission for certain
purposes, including determining possible framework
for future governance of Oregon Medical Marijuana
Program.

HB2216

Requires Department of Human Services to adopt
rules to establish Oregon Foster Children's
Sibling Bill of Rights.

HB2219

Encourages school districts and public charter
schools to offer students courses or other
educational opportunities in civics.

HB2220

Removes certain requirements veterans must meet
prior to receiving high school diploma.

HB2229

Encourages school districts and public charter
schools to offer students courses or other
educational opportunities in financial literacy.

HB2238

Establishes Task Force on Public Safety.

HB2242

Restricts business development project to projects
that result in, aid, promote or facilitate
development of traded sector activities.

HB2244

Permits Oregon Film and Video Office to deduct
from labor rebate amounts spent on workforce
development and educational efforts for qualifying
film production.

HB2246

Expands entities that are eligible to receive
apportionments under Ballot Measure 98 (2016)
to include Oregon School for the Deaf, Youth
Corrections Education Program and Juvenile
Detention Education Program.

HB2248

Extends sunset date on temporary law authorizing
Oregon Youth Authority and county juvenile
departments to disclose and provide copies of
reports and other materials relating to child,
ward, youth or youth offender's history and
prognosis to Department of Corrections for purpose
of exercising custody or supervising person
committed to department's legal and physical
custody.

HB2249

Authorizes Department of Corrections to enter
into agreements or arrangements with counties to
provide supplemental funding for reentry support
and services for offenders released before
attaining 25 years of age.

HB2250

Directs Department of Corrections to adopt
rules establishing deadlines by which department
must submit proposed and revised inmate release
plans to State Board of Parole and Post-Prison
Supervision.

HB2251

Provides that person under 18 years of age may
not be incarcerated in Department of Corrections
institution.

HB2253

Provides that Department of Corrections inmate may
perform electrical or plumbing work if supervised
by licensed electrician or plumber who is employee
of Oregon Corrections Enterprises.

HB2254

Exempts horticultural commodities and commodity
packs from labeling requirements if commodity is
being exported from United States and shipping
container used to transport commodity or commodity
pack is labeled as being for export only and
as otherwise required by State Department of
Agriculture.

HB2255

Authorizes State Department of Agriculture to
adopt recommended or required practices for
ensuring safety of milk, fluid milk or dairy
products.

HB2256

Makes dietary supplements, as defined, food for
purposes of Oregon Food Law and laws regulating
sanitation for food and food establishments.

HB2257

Allows Department of Education to waive, under
limited circumstances, fee for publisher or
supplier who submits textbook title or item of
instructional material for review by State Board
of Education.

HB2258

Expands types of entities that may receive
funding for certain activities related to science,
technology, engineering and mathematics education
and to career and technical education.

HB2259

Authorizes Office of Child Care to maintain
information in Central Background Registry through
electronic records systems.

HB2260

Authorizes Office of Child Care to maintain
information about child care facilities and
providers through electronic records systems.

HB2262

Allows Employment Relations Board to employ and
set salaries for state employees.

HB2263

Increases fee from $500 to $625 for third
mediation session conducted by mediator assigned
by Employment Relations Board to resolve labor
dispute or labor controversy.

HB2264

Increases application fee for individual who
applies to be included on State Conciliation
Service list of qualified arbitrators for labor
controversy.

HB2265

Allows parties to agree in writing to starting
date for 150-day period after which parties
involved in negotiations over terms of collective
bargaining agreement may notify Employment
Relations Board of need for mediator.

HB2266

Allows unexpended and unobligated balance in
Oregon Hatchery Research Center Fund to remain in
fund.

HB2267

Provides exemption from requirement to obtain
medical imaging license if person uses sonographic
equipment for sole purpose of ophthalmic
sonography.

HB2268

Modifies underground storage tank fees.

HB2270

Extends privilege taxes on merchantable forest
products harvested on forestlands.

HB2273

Removes functional test for purposes of
apportionment of business income of corporate
excise taxpayer by defining "sales" to exclude
amounts that are received by taxpayer from certain
transactions, received in role as agent or held in
trust.

HB2275

For purposes of corporate tax apportionment,
redefines income subject to apportionment to align
with Multistate Tax Commission model.

HB2277

Requires county governing body to apply property
tax refund first as credit against amount due
of total tax liability account on which tax was
assessed, except in certain cases.

HB2278

Authorizes municipal corporation to budget for
estimated debt service payments when general
obligation bonds are approved by voters at May
election.

HB2279

Transfers to Department of Revenue sole authority
for examining and registering property appraisers
and setting education and experience requirements.

HB2280

Repeals disused statute granting right to any
person assessed for property taxes to demand
official certificate of assessment and fining
assessor $100 for refusal in action before county
justice of peace.

HB2281

Provides that disqualification of land designated
as forestland shall be deemed to occur as of
January 1 assessment date of assessment year
in which discovery occurs, regardless of when
discovery actually occurs.

HB2283

Provides that if taxpayer elects to apply
overpayment of tax to subsequent year estimated
tax installment, amount paid is credited as
estimated tax on later of first estimated tax due
date or date payment is made, if elected on timely
filed return, or is credited as estimated tax on
later of date return is filed or date payment is
made, if elected on return filed late.

HB2284

Expands provisions for resolution of conflicting
claims to taxpayer dependents to include
conflicting returns or reports addressing other
items allowed under personal income tax laws.

HB2285

Provides that, if taxpayer files report or return
but pays less than full amount of tax due, tax is
assessed on later of original due date of report
or return, without regard for extension of time
for filing, or date filed.

HB2291

Allows weighmaster or motor carrier enforcement
officer to enforce law prohibiting illegal
alteration or display of registration plate.

HB2292

Changes defined term "rail fixed guideway system"
to "rail fixed guideway public transportation
system." Directs Department of Transportation
to take certain actions related to state safety
oversight program of rail fixed guideway public
transportation systems.

HB2294

Adds persons representing public to policy
committees established by Board on Public Safety
Standards and Training.

HB2295

Increases fees, maximum fees and fee return
thresholds for Water Resources Department
services.

HB2296

Increases required bond amounts for persons
drilling wells.

HB2298

Requires that all candidates who will appear on
primary or general election ballot file statements
of economic interest.

HB2300

Establishes Mental Health Clinical Advisory Group
in Oregon Health Authority to develop evidence-
based algorithms for prescription drug treatment
of mental health disorders in medical assistance
recipients.

HB2301

Specifies circumstances under which Health
Licensing Office is required or permitted to
disclose information obtained during investigation
of certain professions.

HB2302

Permits Oregon Health Authority staff to apply
for additional state or federal benefits on behalf
of Oregon State Hospital patients who will be
discharged.

HB2303

Modifies date by which coordinated care
organization must report to Oregon Health
Authority proportion of total medical costs
allocated to primary care.

HB2304

Adds peer support specialist, family support
specialist and youth support specialist to
membership of Traditional Health Workers
Commission.

HB2307

Provides that certified evaluator who conducts
court-ordered evaluation of criminal defendant
concerning issue of insanity is not obligated to
evaluate defendant's fitness to proceed unless
issue of defendant's fitness to proceed arises
during evaluation.

HB2308

Provides that in calculation of maximum period
of commitment for defendant lacking fitness to
proceed, defendant must receive credit for each
day defendant is held in jail unless defendant is
charged with certain offenses requiring mandatory
minimum sentences.

HB2309

Provides that progress reports of defendants
lacking fitness to proceed who have been committed
to state mental hospital or facility for treatment
may consist of updates to original examination
reports or evaluations.

HB2310

Modifies provisions regarding schedule by which
local public health authorities must submit local
plans for applying foundational public health
capabilities and implementing foundational public
health programs.

HB2311

Makes 40-40-20 higher education goals relate to
Oregonians completing education, rather than to
all adult Oregonians.

HB2312

Updates certain terms and references used
throughout state law to conform with changes to
federal law associated with enactment of federal
Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.

HB2314

Permits Higher Education Coordinating Commission
to establish by rule minimum hourly training
requirement or student proficiency-based training
requirement standards required for graduating
from hair design, barbering, esthetics or nail
technology schools.

HB2315

Provides that corporate excise tax credit allowed
to lenders that finance affordable housing is not
barred by receipt of housing vouchers by tenants.

HB2316

Requires city with population of less than 25,000
to determine estimated housing need for 20-
year period, inventory buildable land and adopt
measures as part of periodic or legislative review
of comprehensive plan.

HB2317

Increases term of member of State Mortuary and
Cemetery Board from three years to four years.

HB2318

Allows State Parks and Recreation Commission to
adopt schedule by rule setting forth range of
reasonable charges for use of areas established
and maintained by State Parks and Recreation
Department.

HB2319

Creates Mental Health Regulatory Agency.

HB2322

Renames position of State Medical Examiner to
Chief Medical Examiner.

HB2325

Modifies initial terms of office for members of
Travel Information Council so that no more than
two terms expire on same date.

HB2327

Removes guidance statement and framework of
healthy streams partnership from description of
Oregon Plan.

HB2328

Renames State Board of Psychologist Examiners to
Oregon Board of Psychology.

HB2331

Extends until January 2, 2025, sunset for Oregon
Department of Administrative Services program to
make compressed natural gas available for use in
motor vehicles.

HB2332

Requires certain state agencies to determine
maximum ratio of supervisory employees to
nonsupervisory employees and report maximum
supervisory ratio to Joint Committee on Ways and
Means during biennial budget process.

HB2333

Allows state agency that is unable to sell state
real property or equitable interest in state
real property, after following certain procedures
for sale, to continuously offer real property or
equitable interest for sale using any means state
agency considers appropriate.

HB2334

Establishes Juvenile Corrections Population
Forecast Advisory Committee to assist Oregon
Department of Administrative Services in preparing
projections of juvenile offender populations.

HB2335

Permits Director of Department of Consumer
and Business Services, at request of party to
proceeding to close workers' compensation claim,
to appoint as many as three members to panel
of medical arbiters in accordance with criteria
director sets by rule.

HB2336

Permits Director of Department of Consumer and
Business Services to appoint claims processing
agent for self-insured employer or self-insured
employer group that defaults or cancels employer's
or group's certification or that director
decertifies.

HB2337

Increases workers' compensation benefits for
permanent total disability .

HB2338

Specifies only one monthly benefit rate for
children of deceased worker and uniform duration
of benefits for children under 19 years of age.

HB2339

Prohibits out-of-network health care provider from
balance billing patient covered by health benefit
plan or health care service contract for services
provided at in-network health care facility.

HB2340

Authorizes Department of Consumer and Business
Services to permit insurer that discontinued
offering health benefit plans in service area
less than five years previously to resume offering
health benefit plans in service area.

HB2341

Updates Insurance Code provisions applicable
to health insurance in accordance with federal
requirements.

HB2342

Authorizes Department of Consumer and Business
Services to adopt rules not in compliance
with Insurance Code if necessary due to change
in federal law or decision by federal agency
that Director of Department of Consumer and
Business Services determines will cause imminent
destabilization of insurance market and risk life
or health of state residents.

HB2343

Replaces requirements for State Department of
Energy to complete biennial comprehensive energy
plan and biennial energy forecast with requirement
for department to complete biennial comprehensive
energy report.

HB2344

Modifies qualifications and requirements for
unmarried person who is at least 16 years of age
and not older than 20 years of age to participate
in independent living programs in independent
residence facilities.

HB2346

Directs insured institution or credit union to
accept declaration rather than affidavit from
Department of Human Services or Oregon Health
Authority to pay claim on death of depositor.

HB2355

Directs Oregon Criminal Justice Commission to
develop method for recording data concerning
officer-initiated pedestrian and traffic stops.

HB2356

Establishes requirements under which debt buyer
or debt collector that acts on debt buyer's behalf
may bring legal action to collect debt.

HB2357

Extends provisions relating to contempt of court
by corporations to other entities that are not
natural persons.

HB2358

Increases charitable gaming maximum prize value
for bingo or lotto games.

HB2359

Removes requirement for beneficiary in trust deed
to send, and Attorney General to receive, copy
of notice that beneficiary has denied grantor's
eligibility for foreclosure avoidance measure.

HB2360

Modifies reporting obligation for sex offenders by
requiring report within 10 days following change
of residence.

HB2364

Corrects inaccurate statutory reference.

HB2377

Authorizes city or county to adopt ordinance
or resolution granting exemption for newly
rehabilitated or constructed multiunit rental
housing.

HB2388

Allows Department of Consumer and Business
Services to deny, revoke or suspend registration
of pharmacy benefit manager if pharmacy benefit
manager engages in specified conduct.

HB2391

Imposes 1.5 percent assessment on commercial
health insurance premiums and premium equivalents
for managed care organizations and Public
Employees' Benefit Board health benefit plans.

HB2393

Specifies case manager's duties in event that
case manager receives notice that person for whom
case manager provides services will have life-
sustaining procedures withheld or withdrawn.

HB2397

Changes name of Public Health Advisory Committee
to Public Health and Pharmacy Formulary Advisory
Committee.

HB2398

Prohibits health care provider from billing
medical assistance applicant or recipient except
as provided by Oregon Health Authority by rule.

HB2399

Establishes Condon Collection at University of
Oregon Museum of Natural and Cultural History
as official depository for any material of
paleontological nature that may come into
possession of State of Oregon.

HB2400

Authorizes any state agency or department to enter
into agreements with any political subdivision
for collection, enforcement, administration and
distribution of local transient lodging taxes of
such political subdivision.

HB2401

Requires Department of Human Services to provide
trauma-informed training to child welfare
personnel.

HB2402

Directs Oregon Health Authority to establish grant
program through which individual who is homeless
may obtain certified copy of individual's record
of live birth at reduced cost or free of charge.

HB2403

Requires drivers to exchange insurance information
after motor vehicle accident.

HB2405

Authorizes State Parks and Recreation Director
to adopt rules to establish standards used when
department disburses moneys to tribal governments
under state or federal programs and to make state
funding assistance available to tribal governments
for constructing and restoring memorials honoring
veterans and war memorials on public property.

HB2407

Replaces authority of county assessor to issue
deferred billing credit in cases of high-value
property tax appeals with authority to issue
potential refund credit.

HB2409

Permits city to issue citation for speeding
using red light camera in conjunction with other
technology that is capable of measuring speed.

HB2432

Directs Health Licensing Office to issue license
to engage in practice of art therapy to qualified
applicant.

HB2457

Alters process for resolving student complaints
against certain schools.

HB2462

Increases amount by which vehicle equipped with
fully functional idle reduction system designed to
reduce fuel use and emissions from engine idling
may exceed maximum weight limitations.

HB2463

Allows Department of Transportation and person,
under certain circumstances, to enter into
agreement that enables person to transact certain
functions of department on behalf of department.

HB2482

Limits self-service fuel dispensing to low-
population counties of eastern Oregon and
specified counties.

HB2499

Establishes process for vessel permit seller
to petition for preliminary injunction allowing
seller to continue to fish under vessel permit
during pendency of proceeding concerning claim
that buyer failed to fulfill terms of vessel
permit sale.

HB2500

Directs Department of Human Services, in
consultation with Department of Justice, to
develop and implement training and continuing
education curriculum for caseworkers that informs
and instructs caseworkers on their roles in
juvenile dependency proceedings.

HB2503

Allows Health Licensing Office to issue lactation
consultant licenses to qualified applicants.

HB2505

Subject to enumerated exceptions, expands
definition of "communication in support of or
in opposition to a clearly identified candidate
or measure" within definition of "independent
expenditure" to include aggregate expenses of $750
or more that refer to candidate or political party
within 30 calendar days of primary election or 60
calendar days of general election.

HB2510

Authorizes commercial tenant to install on
premises and use electric vehicle charging
station.

HB2511

Authorizes residential tenant to install on
premises and use electric vehicle charging station
for personal, noncommercial use.

HB2516

Allows State Parks and Recreation Department to
issue permits to entities to restore, maintain and
preserve abandoned cemeteries.

HB2527

Allows pharmacists to prescribe and administer
injectable hormonal contraceptives and prescribe
and dispense self-administered hormonal
contraceptives.

HB2533

Eliminates State Department of Agriculture bee
colony registration fee for colonies having
primary purpose of producing new queens or workers
to start new colony or add to existing colony.

HB2562

Requires lender that has contract with person for
reverse mortgage to send person or escrow agent,
title insurance company or other agent that pays
property taxes on person's behalf notice that
states that title to property that is subject to
reverse mortgage remains with person and person is
responsible for paying property taxes and related
taxes on property.

HB2565

Changes how priority enrollment system is applied
to continuing qualified students and new qualified
students.

HB2566

Extends age range of youth eligible to participate
in youth hunter mentoring program to persons
between nine and 16 years of age.

HB2568

Specifies, for purposes of exempting certain
vehicles from overall allowable length of
vehicles under Vehicle Code, that unplanned
disruption in services provided by public utility,
telecommunications utility, people's utility
district, municipality or electric cooperative
is emergency if disruption occurs outside normal
business hours during which public utility,
telecommunications utility, people's utility
district, municipality or electric cooperative may
acquire variance permit.

HB2572

Allows Commissioner of Bureau of Labor and
Industries to issue multiyear license to
qualifying labor contractor.

HB2573

Clarifies language relating to certain personal
property not subject to ad valorem property
taxation.

HB2575

Expands exemption from requirement to equip
vehicle with brakes to include certain trailers
that transport dories.

HB2576

Exempts from wildlife trafficking prevention
program sale of covered animal species part
or product by or to bona fide scientific or
educational institution when sale entered into
before July 1, 2017.

HB2579

Authorizes Oregon Youth Authority to provide
reentry support and services, for specified
period of time, to person who completes Department
of Corrections incarceration sentence while in
physical custody of authority.

HB2586

Exempts fees associated with filing voters'
pamphlet statement from $750 threshold required to
file as political committee.

HB2591

Designates month of May of each year as Williams
Syndrome Awareness Month.

HB2594

Allows nonimmigrant authorized to enter United
States under Compact of Free Association to be law
enforcement officer.

HB2597

Renames offense of operating motor vehicle while
using mobile communication device as offense
of driving motor vehicle while using mobile
electronic device.

HB2598

Expands offense of vehicular assault to include
contact with motorcycle, motorcycle operator or
motorcycle passenger.

HB2600

Transfers authority over court appointed special
advocates and CASA Volunteer Programs from Oregon
Volunteers Commission for Voluntary Action and
Service to Oregon Department of Administrative
Services.

HB2601

Makes nonsubstantive and technical changes in
Oregon law.

HB2605

Increases number of circuit court judges in
judicial districts consisting of Josephine County
and Washington County.

HB2608

Modifies applicability of previous amendments to
Oregon Uniform Trust Code.

HB2610

Specifies methods by which persons may sign and
transfer corporation's documents in electronic
form.

HB2611

Subject to collective bargaining agreement or
employment agreement, requires law enforcement
unit that hires police or corrections officer
originally hired by another law enforcement unit,
upon written request of original employing law
enforcement unit, to reimburse original employing
law enforcement unit for certain expenses incurred
by original employing law enforcement unit.

HB2616

Sets forth circumstances under which court shall
appoint counsel for youth in juvenile delinquency
proceedings.

HB2618

Increases certain fees collected by sheriffs.

HB2619

Permits pawnbroker to notify pledgor by electronic
mail or other electronic means that pledge is at
risk of forfeiture if pledgor agrees in writing to
notification method.

HB2621

Specifies what constitutes notification to law
enforcement officials for purpose of determining
eligibility of crime victim for Department of
Justice compensation award.

HB2622

Authorizes financial institution to refuse certain
financial transactions when financial institution
reasonably believes financial exploitation of
vulnerable person may have occurred, may have been
attempted or is being attempted.

HB2623

Allows trustee of trust to make disbursements
for trustee's compensation or compensation of
person providing investment advisory or custodial
services out of principal or income under certain
circumstances.

HB2624

Exempts out-of-state banks, extranational
institutions and foreign associations from
requirement to file notice before dealing in notes
secured by mortgages or trust deeds, if authorized
to conduct banking business in this state by
certificate of Department of Consumer and Business
Services.

HB2625

Provides that forfeiture petition may be filed for
animal impounded pending outcome of animal crime
even if specific animal is not named in charging
instrument.

HB2630

Makes changes to Oregon guardianship laws to
ensure adequate safeguards for respondents and
protected persons.

HB2633

Clarifies that statutes regulating sexual abuse
specific treatment apply to provision of sexual
abuse specific treatment to any person.

HB2638

Modifies laws related to ignition interlock
devices.

HB2644

Provides that administration of vitamin K to
newborn infants must be by most effective means.

HB2648

Authorizes Department of Human Services or

Directs State Chief Information Officer to include

For purposes of tax credit for contributions to

Requires hospital to adopt policy for release

HB3459

Exempts from property taxation real and personal

donated to nonprofit corporation that provides
animal rescue services, to manufacturer or
provider of goods or services in return for which
nonprofit corporation that provides animal rescue
services receives equivalen

Prohibits public body from disclosing specified

HB5003

Appropriates moneys from General Fund to

HB2403

HB2407

HB2409

Authorizes commercial tenant to install on

premises and use electric vehicle charging station

HB2515

HB2516

HB2525

HB2572

Allows Commissioner of Bureau of Labor and

HB2573

Clarifies language relating to certain personal

HB2616

HB2618

HB2633

Modifies laws related to ignition interlock

HB2666

Directs State Chief Information Officer to include

Establishes Task Force on Anonymous Text Message

HB3090

maintains, deletes or disposes of in

bearing animals or honeybees or the produce
thereof" to conjunctive "feeding, breeding,
managing and selling livestock, poultry, fur-
bearing animals or honeybees or the produce
thereof." Takes effect on 91st day following
adjournment sine die.

HB2283

Provides that if taxpayer elects to apply
overpayment of tax to subsequent year estimated
tax installment, amount paid is credited as
estimated tax on later of first estimated tax due
date or date payment is made, if elected on timely

later of date return is filed or date payment is
made, if elected on return filed late.

HB2284

Expands provisions for resolution of conflicting
claims to taxpayer dependents to include

items allowed under personal income tax laws.

HB2285

Provides that, if taxpayer files report or return
but pays less than full amount of tax due, tax is
assessed on later of original due date of report
or return, without regard for extension of time
for filing, or date filed.

HB2286

Requires that transfer of tax credit follow
uniform transfer procedures.

HB2287

Clarifies that registration period for vehicles
initially registered on February 29 for four years
will expire on last day of February four years
later.

HB2288

Authorizes issuance of lottery bonds for Connect
Oregon.

HB2289

Eliminates weight limit for exception to user's

HB2290

Adjusts certain fees imposed by Department of
Transportation.

HB2291

Allows weighmaster or motor carrier enforcement

HB2292

Changes defined term "rail fixed guideway system"

system." Directs Department of Transportation

transportation systems.

HB2293

Creates penalty for unbonded or unlicensed sale or

HB2294

Adds persons representing public to policy

HB2295

Increases fees, maximum fees and fee return

HB2296

Increases required bond amounts for persons

Extends sunset for Task Force on Drought Emergency

Requires that all candidates who will appear on

Repeals requirement that Oregon Government Ethics

HB2300

Establishes Mental Health Clinical Advisory Group

recipients.

HB2301

Specifies circumstances under which Health

Permits Oregon Health Authority staff to apply

HB2309

Provides that progress reports of defendants

HB2310

Modifies provisions regarding schedule by which

HB2311

HB2312

Updates certain terms and references used

HB2313

Revises types of programs considered accelerated

Permits Higher Education Coordinating Commission

HB2316

HB2317

Increases term of member of State Mortuary and

HB2318

Allows State Parks and Recreation Commission to

and maintained by State Parks and Recreation

HB2319

Creates Mental Health Regulatory Agency.

HB2320

Directs State Marine Board to create Nonmotorized

HB2321

Requires boat operators to drain water from

HB2322

Renames position of State Medical Examiner to

HB2323

Exempts retired member of Public Employees
Retirement System from limitations on reemployment

HB2324

Provides that offensive littering constitutes

HB2325

Modifies initial terms of office for members of

HB2326

Exempts from public disclosure name of person

HB2327

Removes guidance statement and framework of
healthy streams partnership from description of
Oregon Plan.

HB2328

Renames State Board of Psychologist Examiners to

HB2329

Permits State Board of Psychologist Examiners

person.

HB2330

Permits, rather than requires, state agency to

Extends until January 2, 2025, sunset for Oregon

Requires certain state agencies to determine

HB2333

Increases workers' compensation benefits for
permanent total disability .

HB2338

Specifies only one monthly benefit rate for

HB2339

Prohibits out-of-network health care provider from

HB2340

Authorizes Department of Consumer and Business
Services to permit insurer that discontinued

HB2341

Updates Insurance Code provisions applicable

Authorizes Department of Consumer and Business
Services to adopt rules not in compliance

HB2343

Replaces requirements for State Department of
Energy to complete biennial comprehensive energy

energy report.

HB2344

Modifies qualifications and requirements for
unmarried person who is at least 16 years of age

Extends sunset on provision authorizing Department

HB2346

Directs insured institution or credit union to

HB2347

Extends for two years Department of Human
Services' authority to prescribe employability
assessment and orientation process for job
opportunity and basic skills program and

participants in program; to require single parent
of child under two years of age to participate in
job opportunity and basic skills program; to deny
request of recipient in temporary assistance for
needy families program to enroll in educational
institution as allowable work act

HB2348

Increases amount of revenue from business registry

HB2349

Prohibits printing or circulation of imitation

HB2350

Directs Secretary of State to conduct evaluation

Requires person, political committee or petition

Requires corporations, incorporators of

identifying information for each of corporation's
or limited liability company's beneficial owners.

HB2354

Requires person to obtain or renew license from

HB2355

Directs Oregon Criminal Justice Commission to

HB2356

Establishes requirements under which debt buyer

HB2357

Extends provisions relating to contempt of court

natural persons.

HB2358

Increases charitable gaming maximum prize value
for bingo or lotto games.

HB2359

Removes requirement for beneficiary in trust deed
to send, and Attorney General to receive, copy

HB2360

Modifies reporting obligation for sex offenders by
requiring report within 10 days following change

HB2361

Removes exemption from licensure by Oregon Board

HB2362

Provides that right and privilege to construct,

HB2363

Authorizes counties to withhold from taxing

HB2364

Corrects inaccurate statutory reference.

Establishes Task Force on the Transfer of Federal

HB2368

Prohibits Department of Education from requiring

Requires Legislative Fiscal Officer to prepare

Directs State Department of Agriculture to

HB2372

Establishes Oregon Industrial Hemp Commission.

HB2373

Expands rural health care income tax credit to

HB2374

Authorizes city or county to adopt ordinance

Allows employer to pay 85 percent of minimum wage

HB2379

Adds status as peace officer or firefighter to

HB2380

Creates crime of threatening a mass injury event.

HB2381

Establishes that violation of ethics law occurs

engage in campaign activity.

HB2382

Directs Department of Education to coordinate

achievement and improve college attendance
and career placement for students enrolled in
agricultural education courses.

HB2383

Requires legislative measure to contain brief and

to solve.

HB2384

Sets limit on taxes due on homesteads of seniors
living on fixed income equal to total amount of
taxes due for property tax year preceding first
property tax year for which relief allowed.

HB2385

Reduces corporate excise tax rates for taxpayer

Directs each manufacturer of certain types of
drugs that are sold within this state to develop
and implement drug take-back program for purpose
of collecting from individuals and nonbusiness
entities those types of drugs for disposal.

HB2387

Creates Oregon Premium Protection Program in
Department of Consumer and Business Services and
establishes Oregon Premium Protection Fund.

HB2388

Allows Department of Consumer and Business
Services to deny, revoke or suspend registration

HB2389

Requires Oregon Health Authority to convene
work group to advise and assist in implementing

HB2390

Allows chiropractic physicians and naturopathic

Imposes 1.5 percent assessment on commercial

Modifies requirements for health benefit plan

Directs State Board of Pharmacy to adopt rules

Makes legislative findings regarding provision of

Changes name of Public Health Advisory Committee

HB2398

Prohibits health care provider from billing

Establishes Condon Collection at University of

HB2402

Requires drivers to exchange insurance information

HB2411

Allows elector with inactive registration to

HB2412

Provides that language-based computer coding

HB2413

HB2414

HB2415

Creates tax credit for educational expenses paid

HB2416

Establishes Oregon Empowerment Scholarship Program

HB2417

Allows public charter school to change sponsorship

HB2418

Removes sunset on authority of institution of

HB2419

Provides funding for instruction of talented and

Allows parents to submit petition to school

Requires sponsor of public charter school to pay

Provides that certain grants and distributions

HB2426

Requires that Legislative Administrator develop

Requires all information provided as part of

HB2431

Establishes Task Force on Voter Inactivation and

Directs Health Licensing Office to issue license

HB2433

Directs Housing and Community Services Department

Exempts claims based on conduct that constitutes

HB2435

Exempts funding or other assistance provided to

HB2436

Provides for payment of program expenses of study

HB2437

Increases per-gallon aircraft fuel taxes.

Requires Department of Human Services to operate

Directs Department of Transportation to remove

Provides that employee of public employer is

Requires that statements made by certain witnesses

under oath and therefore subject to crime of false

HB2443

Eliminates $100 transaction limit before details

and made public.

Directs Housing and Community Services Department

rent subsidy program.

HB2447

Directs State Board of Education to adopt

HB2448

HB2450

HB2451

HB2452

Establishes Task Force on Public Boarding Schools.

HB2453

asset to publicly funded educational program.

HB2454

Provides credit against personal income taxes for

HB2455

Requires public bodies to establish public records

year retention of public records.

HB2456

Permits tax exempt landowner to develop affordable
housing units on rural residential land with
county approval.

HB2457

Alters process for resolving student complaints
against certain schools.

HB2458

Allows nonretail facility located in low-
population county to permit self-service retail
sales of Class 1 flammable liquids.

HB2459

Establishes Task Force on Brownfields Tax Credits.

HB2460

Permits school bus driver to operate video
recording device for purpose of recording persons

HB2461

Establishes process for issuance of certificate of
approval for operating autonomous vehicles.

HB2462

Increases amount by which vehicle equipped with

reduce fuel use and emissions from engine idling

HB2463

Allows Department of Transportation and person,

agreement that enables person to transact certain

HB2464

Eliminates caps on number of subject vehicles
eligible to participate in road usage charge
program.

HB2465

as permissible holders of required majority of
each class of shares entitled to vote, as required

Imposes tax on harvest of timber from forestlands

HB2467

Repeals all forest products harvest taxes except

HB2468

Requires Environmental Quality Commission to adopt

limits by no later than January 1, 2018.

Requires Environmental Quality Commission to adopt

Eliminates registration fees on bee colony for
year in which colony is established.

HB3281

Authorizes state agency employee who is licensed
to carry concealed handgun to store personal
handgun and ammunition in locked container in
vehicle while employee is at work and vehicle is

HB3282

Removes psittacines not bred and maintained

for laws regarding offenses committed against
animals, interference with livestock production,
unlawful possession of iodine matrix and dogs
chasing livestock.

HB3283

Amends findings by Legislative Assembly regarding
provision of care and treatment for impounded or
seized animals.

HB3284

Repeals requirement for health care facility to

HB3285

Repeals sunset on provisions that allow students
whose legal residence is not within school
district to attend school in district as resident

HB3286

Requires sponsor of public charter school or

notice to parents of students at public charter
school before taking action that could lead to
closure or significant restructuring of public
charter school.

HB3287

Prohibits state agency from adopting
administrative rule or enacting or enforcing

prohibiting possession of firearm by concealed

HB3288

Requires each public university to submit to
Higher Education Coordinating Commission report

positions and other cost drivers at university.

HB3289

Directs Higher Education Coordinating Commission
to submit annual report to interim committees of
Legislative Assembly that describes progress made
in providing competency-based education in public
post-secondary institutions of education.

HB3290

Requires Higher Education Coordinating Commission
to recognize and endorse online, competency-
based education as important component of
Oregon's system of higher education and to
select regionally accredited nonprofit online
baccalaureate degree granting institution of
higher education to work with and to integrate
programs and services of institution into Oregon's
higher education policy and strategy.

HB3291

Directs Oregon Department of Administrative
Services, in coordination with Legislative
Fiscal Officer and Legislative Revenue Officer,
to prepare biennial budget stress test report
that estimates effects on state finances of
hypothetical negative economic conditions.

HB3292

Reinstates tax credit for long term care insurance

HB3293

Provides that school district may not deny
participation in interscholastic activities by
student who attends public charter school.

HB3294

Limits fees payable to qualified community
development entity in connection with qualified
equity investment.

HB3295

Requires Department of Revenue to estimate
projected amount of revenue, attributable to net
capital gain, to be received by department for
current tax year and to estimate amount received
for previous tax year.

HB3296

Imposes tobacco products tax on tobacco substitute
that contains nicotine but not tobacco and that is

HB3297

Requires, for purposes of taxpayer election
of reduced tax rate for certain pass-through
nonpassive income, net increase in number of

HB3298

Creates refundable personal income tax credit for
mortgage interest payments made for taxpayer's

HB3299

Imposes on owner of foreclosed residential real

unsold and vacant because owner is renovating or
substantially remodeling property.

HB3300

Directs Department of Human Services to develop
and implement two pilot programs in rural
and urban areas of state by contracting with
independent nongovernmental entities to assess
suitability of foster homes for certification.

HB3301

Changes definition of foster parent who is
"current caretaker.".

HB3302

Directs Public Defense Services Commission to
develop and maintain Parent-Child Representation
Program statewide to provide legal representation
in juvenile dependency proceedings based on
workload model of contracting that provides for
caseload limits.

HB3303

Requires hospital to have protocol to ensure that
law enforcement agency is notified within seven
days of collection of sexual assault forensic
evidence kit and that kits are stored for no less
than 60 days after collection.

HB3304

Allows taxpayer to direct portion of income tax
refund to purpose of providing housing to low
income persons.

HB3305

Includes travel trailers as vehicles that
are subject to state's "lemon law." Declares
emergency, effective on passage.

HB3306

Prohibits state agency from adopting
administrative rule limiting or prohibiting
possession of firearm by concealed handgun
licensee who is respondent of or protected by
active protective order.

HB3307

Requires Environmental Quality Commission to adopt
by rule program for regulating air contaminant
emissions from new facilities generating methane

HB3308

Requires Environmental Quality Commission to adopt
by rule program for regulating air contaminant
emissions from dairy confined animal feeding

HB3309

Extends time limitation to bring certain pay
equity claims by making each subsequent payroll
action that is based on underlying pay equity

HB3310

Confirms that discrimination claim may address
disparate impact discrimination, or action that is

HB3311

States that legislative policy of State of Oregon
is to recognize right to due process of law.

HB3312

For rules implementing certain federal
environmental laws that Environmental Quality
Commission or Department of Environmental Quality
has been delegated authority to administer,
prohibits commission from amending or revising
rules to be less stringent than certain federal
standards and requirements.

HB3313

Allows public charter school to give priority in
admission to students who reside within attendance

specified conditions are met.

HB3314

Directs State Registrar of Center for Health
Statistics to send to Department of Consumer and
Business Services each calendar quarter names
of children born in Oregon to residents of this
state.

HB3315

Directs Oregon Health Authority to establish
program under which authority oversees
establishment of kiosks for purpose of collecting
from consumers and disposing of certain drugs.

HB3316

Allows certain school districts to apply for
grants for certain elementary schools to provide
additional daily hour of English instruction
if school performance on statewide summative
assessment for English falls below specified
levels.

HB3317

Effective January 1, 2018, repeals nonurban county
minimum wage tier and replaces it with urban
minimum wage tier for certain cities, increasing
incrementally on annual basis through 2023.

HB3318

Establishes procedures for conducting functional
behavioral assessments and for developing,
reviewing and revising behavior intervention
plans for students with individualized education

HB3319

Establishes minimum amount that Legislative
Assembly must appropriate to Department of
Veterans' Affairs in each biennium, apart from
appropriations from veterans' services fund
established under Ballot Measure 96 (2016).

HB3320

Imposes fee on money transmission made by person
other than corporation to location outside state.

HB3321

Requires nonprofit corporations that meet certain
requirements, including receipt of public funds,
to comply with open meetings law and public
records law, to post copy of corporation's
proposed annual budget to corporation's public
website and to submit to and cooperate with audit.

HB3322

Requires person that engages in business as
vehicle repair shop to obtain certificate from
Director of Department of Consumer and Business
Services.

HB3323

Increases from $40,000 to $100,000 amount of bond
or letter of credit that certain vehicle dealers
are required to purchase.

HB3324

Requires Director of Department of Consumer and
Business Services to provide incentive to small
employers to participate in consultative services,
to provide maximum allowable protection from fines
and penalties to small employers that participate
in consultative services and to promote
consultative services to small business community.

HB3325

Creates income tax credit for investment in
community gardens and food banks.

HB3326

Authorizes centrally assessed company with
outstanding property taxes of at least $174
million for property tax years beginning before
July 1, 2016, to satisfy tax liability by paying
75 percent of amount due.

HB3327

Authorizes district school boards to take
specified actions to facilitate creation and use
of maker spaces.

HB3328

Modifies law regarding requirement that public
employer grant preference to veteran or disabled
veteran in selection process for civil service
position.

HB3329

Directs Appraiser Certification and Licensure
Board to establish program to award grants to
state certified appraisers and state licensed
appraisers to whom board issues certificate or
license on or after January 1, 2018.

HB3330

Permits city or county to impose controls on
rental rates and rental rate increases applicable
to spaces in facilities for manufactured or
floating homes.

HB3331

Directs Office of Manufactured Dwelling Park
Community Relations to establish and administer
landlord-tenant dispute resolution program for
disputes arising from notices of certain rent
increases.

HB3332

Limits amount and procedure by which landlord may
increase rent for manufactured dwelling space or
floating home space.

HB3333

Requires insurers and third party administrators
to pay claims for out-of-network health services

identified by Department of Consumer and Business
Services.

HB3334

Requires Legislative Counsel to produce draft
measures in order in which measures were
requested.

HB3335

Requires Higher Education Coordinating Commission
to develop plan for enabling community colleges to

with credits earned in apprenticeship or training

HB3336

Permits individual to create family medical leave
savings account with financial institution to pay
or reimburse qualified beneficiary's wage loss
during family medical leave of absence from work.

HB3337

Creates limited landscape construction
professional license.

HB3338

Requires State Department of Agriculture to adopt
rules governing posting of tax information by gas
stations.

HB3339

Increases speed limit on Oregon Route 138 between
Roseburg and Glide.

HB3340

Requires Department of Education to develop and
provide to public high schools written materials
regarding apprenticeship opportunities.

HB3341

Establishes Task Force on Rural Medical Training
Facilities.

HB3342

Prohibits requiring high school diploma or General
Educational Development (GED) certificate as
qualification for obtaining limited specialty
plumber license to install or replace residential
water heaters.

HB3343

Directs State Department of Energy to develop
climate test to conduct reviews for approval of

HB3344

Prohibits Legislative Assembly from funding new

HB3345

For purposes of Oregon Indoor Clean Air Act,

units.

HB3346

Establishes grant program under which Department
of Education awards grants to school districts for

HB3347

Directs Department of Education to identify and
adopt procedures for reporting and collecting data

HB3348

Provides that electric company may use electricity

HB3349

Requires Oregon Liquor Control Commission to

bottle bill.

HB3350

Creates Office of Outdoor Recreation within State
Parks and Recreation Department.

HB3351

Directs Teacher Standards and Practices Commission
to prepare annual report related to duties, powers
and functions of commission.

HB3352

Directs Oregon Health Authority to conduct
evaluation related to behavioral health services
provided to public school students.

HB3353

Provides that when school district or
prekindergarten program causes dental screening

request not to participate in dental screening.

HB3354

Provides that Oregon estate tax is not due unless

HB3355

Authorizes State Board of Psychologist Examiners
to issue certificate of prescriptive authority
to licensed psychologist who meets specified
requirements.

HB3356

Removes existing specification of maximum
application and processing fees local government

Liquor Control Commission issuance or renewal of
license.

HB3357

Increases amount of fees charged and collected
by county clerks to record or file certain real
property documents.

HB3358

Directs Department of Education to convene
advisory group related to English language learner
programs.

HB3359

Modifies civil penalties, license regulation and
licensing fees for certain facilities regulated by
Department of Human Services.

HB3360

Directs each county within Metro to adopt
application procedures for removal of rural
reserve designation from certain parcels.

HB3361

Directs State Chief Information Officer to appoint
Chief Data Officer to maintain web portal for
publication of data of state agencies.

HB3362

Creates income tax credit for taxpayers that
provide apprenticeship opportunities.

HB3363

Changes term "osteopath" to "osteopathic
physician." Clarifies that doctors of osteopathic
medicine practice medicine as physicians.

HB3364

Permits payment of up to $3,000 in emergency

Prohibits official action relating to employment

list.

HB3366

Requires landlord to deposit and maintain security

and inform tenant of financial institution in
which security deposit is held.

HB3367

Directs State Registrar of Center for Health
Statistics to send to State Treasurer each
calendar quarter names of children born in Oregon
to residents of this state.

HB3368

Prohibits law enforcement agency from having or
establishing arrest or citation quota policy.

HB3369

Directs law enforcement agency to notify Attorney
General when police officer's use of deadly

HB3370

Defines "housing with services project" and
requires project to register with Department of
Human Services .

HB3371

Creates 24/7 sobriety program.

HB3372

Requires coordinated care organization to provide

Services.

HB3373

Appropriates moneys to Housing and Community

housing.

HB3374

Provides grants to counties that received Secure

HB3375

Directs Oregon Business Development Department
to develop and administer program to issue grants
to address tourism-related coastal infrastructure
needs.

HB3376

Directs Oregon Health Authority to establish
immunization records retention program.

HB3377

Directs Oregon Business Development Department
to report to Legislative Assembly on department's

Secretary of State.

HB3378

Allows expunction of certain juvenile records

criminal conviction or juvenile adjudication.

HB3379

Provides for establishment of percentage by which
district school board shall annually increase
total amount of moneys used to pay for salary and
benefits of employees under collective bargaining
agreement.

HB3380

Modifies eligibility for Family Sentencing
Alternative Pilot Program.

HB3381

Requires prospective contractor to state in
bid or proposal for public contract whether and
extent to which prospective contractor will use
conflict minerals in performing public contract
and whether prospective contractor's disclosures,
policies, practices and procedures with respect to
procuring conflict minerals comply with rules that
Securities and Exchange Commission promulgates

1934.

HB3382

Provides that projects that make water

Waterway.

HB3383

Establishes refundable tax credit against income
or corporate excise taxes for employers in

employees at or below specified rate.

HB3384

Designates office of Secretary of State as
nonpartisan.

HB3385

Extends sunset on provisions allowing retired
member of Public Employees Retirement System to
be reemployed by participating public employer as
teacher of career and technical education without
loss of retirement benefits.

HB3386

Requires Environmental Quality Commission to adopt
by rule program for facilitating compliance with
low carbon fuel standards.

HB3387

Establishes Task Force on System Development
Charges and specifies composition of task force
membership.

HB3388

Provides that person may not make retail sale of
tobacco product or inhalant delivery system at or

sells tobacco product or inhalant delivery system
at or from premises for which license has been
issued.

HB3389

Expands criteria for traffic offenses related to
rail crossings and adds requirement for drivers to

HB3390

Requires city with population of 200,000 or fewer

HB3391

Requires health benefit plan coverage of specified
health care services, drugs, devices, products and

HB3392

Establishes state policies and judicial practices
regarding blindness in individuals who are

HB3393

HB3394

Authorizes local governments to assess system
development charges for disaster resilience and

HB3395

Allows school district to employ person licensed

HB3396

Internet service providers and television service

confirmation of verbally agreed upon rate, term

HB3397

Requires Legislative Assembly to provide
translator services free of charge, in order to

Legislative Assembly, or as required by federal

HB3398

Extends sunset on Oregon Medical Insurance Pool

appropriates moneys in account to Department of
Consumer and Business Services.

HB3399

Requires State Chief Information Officer by rule
to require contracting agency that undertakes
information technology initiative to provide in
solicitation documents and public contract that
contractor that supplies electronic database

stored data must supply contracting agency with
capability to export data in nonproprietary open
format and to redact from data information that
contracting agency may not disclose.

HB3400

Limits requirements and standards insurer

physicians.

HB3401

Prohibits local government from applying

land that have effect of reducing development

comprehensive plan designation.

HB3402

Limits hours that nurses employed in Department of
Corrections institutions may work.

HB3403

Imposes tax on distribution of inhalant product

HB3404

Requires children under two years of age to

HB3405

Requires Department of Human Services to seek

recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance to

HB3406

Directs Secretary of State to conduct evaluation

HB3407

Requires Secretary of State to conduct study and

HB3408

Clarifies that person may register to vote or

deliver voter registration card to designated
agency or official.

HB3409

Exempts from compulsory school attendance
requirements children who are present in United

HB3410

Allows labor arbitrator to consider county

HB3411

Allows labor arbitrator to consider reasonable
alternative to last best offers by each party

HB3412

Establishes Task Force on Assessments of Children

HB3413

Requires public charter school to obtain written

HB3414

Establishes retirement benefits payable under

Retirement System on or after effective date of
Act.

HB3415

Imposes requirements upon mental health treatment

HB3416

Directs Department of Transportation to offer
extended weekday hours and Saturday operating

HB3417

Requires Public Defense Services Commission
to adopt policies, procedures, standards and

HB3418

Requires Legislative Policy and Research Director
to convene advisory group to study reimbursment of
prescription drugs in medical assistance program,

plans, Oregon Educators Benefit Board health
benefit plans and other state-financed programs.

HB3419

Requires member of Legislative Assembly who has

staff to file statement with Oregon Government

each relative or member of household receives in
salary.

HB3420

Ensures that private sector labor organizations

union security agreements to full extent allowed

HB3421

Requires Water Resources Department to maintain

HB3422

Requires Secretary of State to permit authorized

HB3425

Requires that state goals for food fish management

consideration of and proportionate with revenues

HB3426

HB3427

Requires owner or operator of dam with high hazard

HB3428

Enrolls specified public employees in coordinated

HB3429

Clarifies definition of "covered animal species"

HB3430

Provides that Department of State Lands shall

HB3431

HB3433

Appropriates moneys from General Fund to

HB3434

Extends sunset date for public safety fiscal

HB3436

Defines terms related to construction material

HB3437

Establishes legislative findings and intent

HB3438

Directs Department of Corrections to include

transitional housing or treatment programs to
which inmate has been accepted.

HB3439

Requires that in professional corporation that
is organized to allow physicians, physician
assistants and nurse practitioners to jointly
render professional health care services,
physicians, physician assistants or nurse
practitioners must hold majority of voting shares
and be majority of directors of professional
corporation.

HB3440

Removes special training requirement from statutes

HB3441

Creates crime of unlawful possession of prohibited
container on public beach.

HB3442

Creates crime of unlawful dissemination of a
commercial recording or audiovisual work.

HB3443

Requires Oregon Liquor Control Commission to
calculate and post on commission's website
previous calendar year's number of beverage
containers that carry refund value sold in Oregon
during calendar year for all distributors and
importers in Oregon.

HB3444

Directs school districts to establish procedure
by which to resolve complaints regarding

HB3445

Directs Commissioner of Bureau of Labor and
Industries to appoint Transportation Network
Company Oversight Board.

HB3446

Provides that court has authority to enter
judgment of conviction for Class A misdemeanor at
any time after person has successfully completed

resulted from habitual offender status and court
makes certain findings.

HB3447

Prohibits provision in instrument conveying real

as premises of exempt family child care provider.

HB3448

Directs Oregon Health Authority to require
by rule, with respect to testing cannabis
and cannabis-derived products for pesticides,

15 pounds or less from same harvest lot, and
inspection of cannabinoid concentrates or extracts
in batches of amount identified by authority by

HB3449

Extends sunset, from January 2, 2018, to

public entity in another state for provision of
correctional services.

HB3450

Authorizes law enforcement agency to exchange

and United States Bureau of Customs and Border
Protection in order to notify federal agencies of
impending release of incarcerated individuals.

HB3451

HB3452

Authorizes public universities and Oregon Health
and Science University to participate in benefit

Benefit Board.

HB3453

Requires, for purposes of property tax exemption,

entered into by institution, organization
or public body whose property is tax exempt

resulting from such exemption shall inure solely
to benefit of lessee institution, organization or
public body.

HB3454

Describes actions school districts are required
to take or are prohibited from taking regarding
students who are unable to pay for meals.

HB3455

Establishes Age Three Through Grade Three Reading
Initiative within Department of Education.

HB3456

Permits establishment of photovoltaic solar
power generation facility on certain high-value

HB3457

Requires statement of economic interest to include

business in which public official or candidate,

candidate, is officer or holds directorship if

HB3458

Directs employer in specified industries to pay

HB3459

Exempts from property taxation real and personal
property, including inventory, of retail store
owned by nonprofit corporation if retail store

operates with substantial support from volunteers
and all net proceeds of retail store sales are
donated to nonprofit corporation that provides
animal rescue services, to manufacturer or
provider of goods or services in return for which
nonprofit corporation that provides animal rescue
services receives equivalen

HB3460

Directs Oregon Health Authority to establish
firearm safety and suicide prevention education
program consisting of creation or approval of
specified educational materials and provision of
materials to gun dealers.

HB3461

Provides Attorney General with increased
enforcement authority over contraband cigarette
sales in conjunction with nonparticipating
manufacturer adjustment settlement related to
tobacco Master Settlement Agreement.

HB3462

Directs Department of Human Services to accomplish
various objectives to improve skills of and
